That's a great idea! Adding a column for the platform or source where you can stream or purchase the movie will help you keep track of availability and make it easier to plan your viewing schedule.

You can create a column with a header like "Platform" or "Source" and list the various streaming services, such as:

* Disney+
* Netflix
* Amazon Prime Video
* Hulu
* Apple TV+
* YouTube
* Vudu
* Google Play Movies & TV
* iTunes
* DVD/Blu-ray
* Rent/Buy

You can also include notes or comments about the platform, such as:

* "Available on Disney+ until [date]"
* "Rent on Amazon Prime Video for $2.99"
* "Free with ads on Tubi"

This will help you keep track of which movies are available on which platforms and make informed decisions about your viewing options.

Here's an updated template:

| Movie Title | Director | Release Year | Genre | Rating | Watched | Notes | Added to Watchlist | Platform |

| The Night is Short, Walk on Girl | Masaaki Yuasa | 2017 | Anime | 7.9 |  |  | =TODAY() | Disney+ |
| Roma | Alfonso Cuarón | 2018 | Drama | 8.1 |  |  | =TODAY() | Netflix |

By including the platform column, you'll be able to quickly see which movies are available on your preferred streaming services and plan your viewing accordingly.

Remember to update your template as you add more movies and platforms to your watchlist!
